intro: Prestonia lindmanii, commonly known as the Lindman's prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, specifically Jamaica. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
